reviews.text: The hotel Bijou is a typical basic Swiss mountain hotel that looks a bit dated with the fixtures and fittings but everything works perfectly which is all that matters when you want a clean bed for the night and good shower.
reviews.title: Friendly hotel

reviews.text: I have stayed in several hotels in Zermatt before and what I liked most about the Bijou was the owner, Andre. Swiss hoteliers are often just functional and it is quite unusual to come across one where the owner/staff are more approachable and engaging. He was helpful with tips on where to go and was conversational. He speaks excellent English.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay!

reviews.text: We had a room facing the Matterhorn and what a wonderful surprise to open the curtains in the morning and see the view.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a bit of a climb up to the hotel so if you have a lot of luggage then you may want to grab a taxi which costs around 25CHF.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel doesn't do meals (except breakfast) so if you are looking for something a bit out of the main street I must recommend the Hotel Cervo for lunch or dinner. We went one day and were surprised to find ourselves eating next to the same people that we had eaten breakfast with in the hotel. It is a bit out of the town centre so call ahead and book. In fact for dinner you need to do a bit of planning as so many places get booked out!
reviews.title: Grand views comfortable digs

reviews.text: My father and I stayed here in Nov 2009 while I was on a business trip to Geneva. The other reviews are correct. Small room (as most European Hotels are), beds were fine, traditional breakfast included in reasonable price, long walk (uphill) from the train station, take taxi cart or bus if you are concerned about the walk. Beautiful town of Zermatt, excellent view of the Matterhorn. Didn't ski so I can't comment. Excellent Service from staff.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Defiantly try the Fondue, Raclette and Würste/Rösti ... yummy Ein Pils bitte!
reviews.title: Superb Views

reviews.text: The hotel is about a mile from the railway station and you can get the electric bus, 3 Francs, from outside the station.
reviews.title: 2nd time around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bijou is a simple, no frills hotel which gives good value for money. It is spotlessly clean, comforable, and has friendly and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Simple, Clean, Quiet and Pet Friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom and bathroom were of a good size and there was a TV with several English speaking channels.
reviews.title: good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel on HotelPortal app on my blackberry. It was the first in the list of hotels located "near Matterhorn", as it was the least expensive for double occupancy for one night. The other rooms may be a bit cheaper still, but ask for 201, 202, 301 (our room) or 302 for a jaw-dropping view of the Matterhorn. The hotel is perfectly comfortable and run by a very friendly father and son (the son's name is Andreas). They take dogs, and are happy to help, guide, accomodate, etc., in any way they can. The breakfast buffet is very sparing, but as we were eating ourselves silly elsewhere ( there is a VERY fine restaurant just a few doors down and a really good hearty Swiss restaurant just a bit down the hill, both recommended by Andreas) we did not need much at breakfast. One can very easily spend a fortune on rooms in Zermatt, but if seeing the Matterhorn is your main reason for going there, then stay at the Bijou and ask for one of those 4 rooms.
reviews.title: Can't beat the view for the price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent the day riding trains and grandolas. When we got to the hotel, in late afternoon, our room key was there on the desk waiting for us. Nice little bar for adult beverages. We had one of the rooms with a view of the Matterhorn. It was an awesome sight. Were asked if we would be joining them for dinner, but we declined the offer, ( I think we should have stayed there, but my wife wanted Fondue. She won out). Had a big breakfast buffet in the morning with fruits, meats, cheeses, breads, both hot and cold cereals. Was almost at the out skirts of town, but I think we had a great view!!!!!!! Room was nice and clean. Bed was comfortable. Would differntly recommend this hotel if you are looking for hotel in Zermatt. Also family run business. When in that part of world again, will be going back.
reviews.title: What a view!!!

reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel! We had the upstairs suite with a great view of the Matterhorn. Andreis (spelling?) was also very helpful and answered our numerous questions about the area. The hotel is about 2-3 min walk from a bus stop. Breakfast was moderate but always on time. We originally took a taxi from Tasch to Zermatt and then another one to the hotel. In retrospect, we could have easily taken the train from Tasch to Zermatt and then the local bus to the Bijou -- that would have saved quite a bit of money.
reviews.title: Friendly, helpful, and great view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for just a night at the BIJOU but did not enjoy it much for the simple reason that there was no staff to even serve coffee/tea after 5pm till 8am in the morning.They just handed us the keys,a map to guide us and advised us to have our dinner in the village.The village is a short ten minutes walk down a steep hill from the hotel and I would advise only the adventurous to stay her. The room though big had old wooden furniture with an ancient TV set . It is a good place for skiers and probably a good hotel in skiing season.
reviews.title: Nice place with beautiful views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok, first things first, the hotel is situated away from the train station and has a very steep climb (if you plan on accessing it by foot). Actually its best advised that one takes a electric taxi to get to the hotel which cost us about CHF 25 from the train station. Trust me the walk to the hotel is not for the average joe.
reviews.title: A trek but completely worth it.

reviews.text: We have been there for a one night. Hotel is clean and nice. Price is acceptable. Breakfast it easy but tasty. Service is really good and owner is really friendly. Amazing wiev on Matterhorn in some bedrooms.
reviews.title: Good service for good price

reviews.text: Great little Swiss hotel. Very tidy and clean, funiture slightly rustique, but very charming. Super location for gletcher ski!
reviews.title: Beautiful surroundings and amazing view

reviews.text: We stayed here for New Year. The Bijou was the only hotel that could accommodate a party of 8 at short notice.
reviews.title: "I'm a host, not a [--]"

reviews.text: The accommodation is clean and functional, but this hotel is definitely "basic". It is at the lower end of the Zermatt price range which means it's still eye-wateringly expensive.
reviews.title: Good hospitality, views & food!

reviews.text: What provided most entertainment (and provides a reasonable picture of what you can expect if you unwisely choose to stay here) was when the (apparently drunk) owner was offended by a pregnant woman in our party requesting that her meat was cooked through. This was followed by a long diatribe ("I'm a host, not a [-]") about how the dietary advice she had been given was incorrect. Good service? Step forward Mr Faulty.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel
